Job Title: Mill Technician

Location: Mountain Pass, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Title: 

Mill Technician

 Location: 

Mountain Pass, CA

 Department/Group: 

Engineering

 Position Type: 

Full Time

 Hourly/Salary: 

Hourly

 Regular/Temp: 

Regular

 Exempt/Non-Exempt: 

Nonexempt

 Reports To: 

Lead Metallurgical Engineer

Position Overview The Mill Technician will work in the Process Technology and Engineering Department and report directly to the Lead Metallurgical Engineer. The person filling this position will follow set procedures and provide results which will be used to maintain and improve mill operational performance. This is normally a day shift position, but it will periodically require short notice flexibility for working other shifts and overtime. The Mill Technician interfaces, collaborates, and coordinates with other members of the Process Development Group, Mill Operations, and also other departments such as Mining, Maintenance, Analytical, Warehouse & Shipping, and training. Position Responsibilities

 Perform sampling of materials throughout the mill & flotation circuit  Perform lab testing including froth flotation  Use mechanical equipment such as filters, sieves, sieve shakers, crushers, grinders, various testing equipment, and basic electrical instrumentation  Use pan and analytical balances  Maintain accurate and legible records  Maintain and order lab supplies for mill laboratory operations  Identify any unsafe activities or unsafe conditions that could result in harm to personnel, damage to property, or impacts to the environment  Accept personal responsibility for safe work practices  Communicate test results, verbally and in writing, to other staff  Keep work areas clean and perform daily pre-work inspections  Maintain safe work practices  Completes any other tasks as needed or as directed by management 

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

 Minimum 1-year work experience in a Chemical, Mining, Petroleum, or heavy industrial setting preferred  Experience making observations and recording results in an industrial environment preferred  MSHA related job site experience preferred 

REQUIRED EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION/LICENSURE

 Minimum High School Diploma/GED  Valid Driver’s License and a good driving record are required in order to drive company vehicles on property. 

Preferred Qualifications

 High school or college level chemistry  AA or bachelor’s degree in related field  Mechanical aptitude  Experience in mineral processing lab and plant flotation  Experience with analytical equipment (XRF) and sample preparation 

SPECIALIZED SKILLS

 Excellent communication skills, verbal and written  Ability to complete a task with minimal supervision  Attention to detail and ability to learn new duties  Ability to work in teams with strong collaboration skills  Ability to work with people at all levels within the organization  Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  Proven record of safety  Must thrive in a high stress start-up environment  Must be able to meet critical deadlines 

SAFETY PROVISION

Employees are responsible for following all company, industry and regulatory procedures and laws to ensure a safe work environment for themselves and the company. Employee must have a willingness to promote safety among the workforce, participate in 5S methodology of housekeeping, process hazard analysis procedures and pre-startup safety reviews.

(PPE) Personal Protective Equipment is required when performing work in a mine, manufacturing, outdoor, or plant environment. Required PPE may include, but is not limited to, hard hat, hearing protection, safety glasses, safety footwear, respirator, rubber steel-toe boots, protective clothing, gloves and any other protective equipment as required.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Our facility sits at an elevation of 4700 feet and employees may subject to extreme weather conditions when working in an outdoor manufacturing plant setting, which may include expose to moving mechanical parts, toxic chemicals, risk of electrical shock, explosives, fumes or airborne particles.

 PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Manual dexterity; sense of touch; sense of smell; speaking clearly; hearing-speech range; hearing – all ranges; seeing, reading and comprehensions; seeing – distant/near; depth perception; color vision.

While performing the responsibilities of the Mill Technician , the employee is required to talk and hear. The employee is often required to stand and use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel and to manipulate equipment. The employee is occasionally required to walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision. Employee must pass a full-face respiratory fit test. Employee must be able to lift 50 lbs. Must be able to work in PPE level C. These requirements are representative, but not all-inclusive, of the knowledge, skill, and ability required of the Mill Technician.

 MP Materials is Proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer - EEO is The Law All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Underrepresented groups/Women/Disabled/Veterans are encouraged to apply. Candidates whose disabilities make them unable to meet the position’s requirements will still be considered qualified if they can perform the essential functions of the job with reasonable accommodation. Your Right To Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment verification document form upon hire. For Assistance with Application - Alternative methods of applying for employment are available to individuals unable to apply to this site because of a disability. Contact Human Resources Department at 702-625-5679; 1700 Pavilion Center Drive 8th floor, Las Vegas, NV 89135 to discuss reasonable accommodations.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
